channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2024040042
item.description:
Report I-2024040042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T00:38:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: ROSEBUD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wilbur Ellis Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. During product handling at the Wilbur-Ellis' facility in Rosebud, TX. A Wilbur-Ellis' employee was moving a 250-gallon tote containing Grayzon Next Herbicide when he cut a turn short, resulting in a puncture to the bottom of the tote. Approximately 250 gallons of free product released, mostly inside of secondary containment. A small amount of the product, approximately 20 gallons, escaped secondary containment, with 15 gallons hitting concrete, and 5 gallons hitting gravel. There was no reported impact to water. There were no reported injuries or exposures. Wilbur-Ellis' personnel reviewed the SOS and responded with appropriate PPE. The product from the impacted tote was recovered and placed into a secondary tote. The impacted gravel and free product was recovered into containers, and will be disposed of via the facility's waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2024050126
item.description:
Report E-2024050126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-05
  • City: MORENCI
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: After loading materials, the driver did not verify all connections were removed before attempting to leave and left the loading arm attached to the trailer. Due to this, the API valve broke off and allowed unprompted release of materials.

item.title: Report E-2024050407
item.description:
Report E-2024050407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T18:14:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: GOLIAD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1214000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 183 in Goliad, Texas when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 5649 gallons of gasoline was released. Clean Harbors responded to the scene and continues to remediate the spill.
